0.title: TMC MP Chhetri demands minority status for Hindus in Meghalaya
0.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Shanta Chhetri on Friday demanded the minority status for Hindus in Meghalaya. "I humbly urge the August House to draw the kind attention of the Home Minister to urgently direct the Meghalaya government to grant minority status to Hindus via a notification as per Articles 29 and 30 of the Constitution of India," Chhetri said.

1.title: Woman's version incomplete, she also sent sexualised texts: Paine on d**k pic scandal
1.article_body: Amid investigation into the d**k pic scandal, ex-Australia Test captain Tim Paine said that the woman's version of the exchange of messages between them is "incomplete and inaccurate". As per Cricket Tasmania, Paine said her messages also contained highly sexualised and explicit sexual content. The case could go to trial as mediation between the parties failed to settle the dispute.

2.title: Delhi Police gets 2 weeks to file status report on attack at CM's home
2.article_body: Delhi HC on Friday asked Delhi Police to file a status report within two weeks on the investigation it has carried out to date in connection to vandalism at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house. AAP alleged BJP workers orchestrated the attack over Kejriwal's comments on 'The Kashmir Files'. "You'll have to explain...what kind of threat perception was there," HC said.

3.title: Amazon has destroyed us: Future Retail to Supreme Court
3.article_body: Advocate Harish Salve, appearing for Future Retail in the Supreme Court, said, "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us." He was referring to the Amazon's litigation to block the ₹27,000-crore asset sale deal between Future and Reliance Retail. The court was hearing Amazon's plea to restrain Future from alienating its retail assets until arbitration between the companies concluded.

4.title: Pakistan was great when you were not the PM: Pak PM Imran Khan's ex-wife
4.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan's ex-wife Reham Khan tweeted, "Pakistan was great when you were not the PM." In an apparent jibe at the Pakistan PM, after he said that he has attained everything in life, Reham tweeted, "The man who has everything but intelligence." Reham's tweets came after the Pakistan PM said he won't resign ahead of the no-trust vote.

5.title: Sara, Vikrant visit Nageshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Gujarat
5.article_body: Actors Sara Ali Khan and Vikrant Massey on Thursday visited the Nageshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Gujarat. "Being there and helping me for har ek baat...Thank you...Jai Bholenath," Sara wrote on Instagram while sharing pictures from their visit. Sara and Vikrant are currently shooting for their upcoming film 'Gaslight' in Gujarat. The film is being directed by Pavan Kripalani.

6.title: They're important in IPL: Jaffer on PBKS' opening pair of Mayank-Shikhar
6.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said PBKS' opening pair of Mayank Agarwal and Shikhar Dhawan are very important for the team in IPL 2022. "They're a left-right combination...both are experienced players. Mayank can play his attacking game as he knows that Dhawan is a calming influence," he added. Skipper Mayank (32) and Dhawan (43) added 71-run first-wicket stand in their opener against RCB.

7.title: Japanese body extends ₹2,391 cr loan for B'luru sewage facilities
7.article_body: The Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) has signed an agreement with the Centre to give ₹2,391 crore as a loan for the construction of water supply and sewage facilities. This will be done under the Bengaluru Water Supply and Sewerage Board Project (Phase 3). JICA has been reportedly supporting such construction in Bengaluru and the surrounding areas since 1996.

8.title: Delhi constable's son among 4 held for gang-raping nurse in B'luru
8.article_body: A Delhi Police head constable's son is among four persons who were arrested for gang-raping a 23-year-old nurse in Bengaluru, a report stated. The incident allegedly occurred when the woman went to meet one of the accused, who she'd befriended on a dating app, at his house. All the accused are in their early 20s and are swimmers from Delhi-NCR.

9.title: India, Russia are good friends & loyal partners: Lavrov after meeting Jaishankar
9.article_body: After meeting External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar in Delhi, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said, "Indian foreign policies are characterised by independence and the concentration on real national legitimate interests." He said that the Russian Federation follows the same policy, adding, "This makes us (India and Russia), as big countries, good friends and loyal partners."

10.title: At least I didn't slap anybody: UK FM on criticism of his wife over Infosys stake
10.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak likened himself to Will Smith after his wife Akshata Murthy faced criticism for owning Infosys shares, which allegedly has a Russian presence. "At least I didn't get up and slap anybody, which is good," Sunak told BBC. He further said, "It's totally fine for people to take shots at me...It's...upsetting...for people to...come at my wife."

11.title: Mumbai court rejects plea of retired policeman in 1989 custodial rape case
11.article_body: The Mumbai sessions court has rejected the plea filed by a retired policeman, who was booked for raping a woman in his custody 33 years ago in 1989. The accused sought to discard the complainant's evidence on technical grounds. The court said the purpose of procedural law is to aid justice and isn't meant to cause a miscarriage of justice.

12.title: 16-year-old boy films female tuition teacher in bathroom in Pune
12.article_body: A 16-year-old boy has been booked for allegedly filming his female tuition teacher when she would use the toilet at his house in Pune. The teacher reportedly found the hidden phone in a soapbox and on checking it, also discovered old pictures and recordings of herself. The tutor had been teaching the boy since he was 10-11 years old.

13.title: Huma Qureshi to play lead role in chef Tarla Dalal's biopic
13.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi is set to play the lead role in the biopic of chef and cookbook author Tarla Dalal. The film is being jointly produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Nitesh Tiwari and Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari. According to reports, the film will be helmed by Piyush Gupta and is expected to go on floors in the coming few months.

14.title: Amazon opened 2nd humanitarian aid hub to help Ukrainians: Bezos
14.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to announce that the firm has opened a second humanitarian aid hub in Poland to help Ukrainian refugees. The firm's first hub for Ukrainian refugees is in Slovakia. The hub is a "fulfilment centre dedicated to this issue, using our logistics and distribution experience to help", Bezos explained.

15.title: Man dies of asphyxiation as fire breaks out at a house in Delhi
15.article_body: A 29-year-old man died as a house in Bindapur's Prem Nagar district in Delhi was gutted in fire on Friday morning. According to the police, the deceased, Lalit, was trying to escape the fire that broke out in the house at 5:15 am when he died of asphyxiation. The reason behind the fire is not known yet.

16.title: Nagaland lifts COVID-19 curbs, advises citizens to continue wearing masks
16.article_body: In view of the declining weekly sample positivity rate of COVID-19 infections in Nagaland, the state government has lifted all COVID-19 curbs with effect from April 1. However, as a precaution, citizens have been advised to continue adhering to COVID-19 appropriate behaviour like wearing face masks in public places, washing or sanitising hands and maintaining physical distancing at all times.

17.title: Volkswagen may allow Audi, Porsche to enter F1 next week: Report
17.article_body: Volkswagen is likely to allow Audi and Porsche to enter Formula One at a meeting next week, Reuters reported citing sources. Audi will offer around $556.30 million for McLaren, while Porsche intends to establish a partnership with racing team Red Bull starting in several years' time. McLaren said it has had some "very preliminary" conversations with VW in the past.

18.title: G-23 never sought a non-Gandhi Congress President: Kamal Nath
18.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath has claimed that the group of rebel Congress leaders, also known as G-23, has never demanded a Congress President outside the Gandhi family. "They (G-23) have been my colleagues for years. They have never made any such demand," Nath said. "They have asked for party elections... which will be held in three months' time," he added.

19.title: Playing for CSK is like a picnic, they do so much for players: Harbhajan
19.article_body: Ex-CSK spinner Harbhajan Singh said playing for the franchise feels like a picnic, adding that CSK take care of the needs of every member of the player's family, even if 10 people want to come. "The other teams don't do that," stated Harbhajan. "A player gets attached...when he sees that CSK are doing so much for him," said Harbhajan.

20.title: Anyone can meet him: KP Maurya on CM Yogi, Shivpal Yadav's meet
20.article_body: A day after PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav met UP CM Yogi Adityanath amid reports of rift with his nephew Akhilesh Yadav, Keshav Prasad Maurya said that Adityanath is the CM and "anyone can meet him". "Yogi Adityanath is CM of 24 crore population in UP. Anyone can meet him. Recently, he also met Akhilesh Yadav," the UP Deputy CM said.

21.title: Nishank to evict govt allotted residence for Scindia: Reports
21.article_body: Former Union Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank is likely to evict his government allotted accommodation (27, Safdarjung Road) soon to make room for Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, reports said. According to sources, Nishank isn't a minister anymore, which makes him ineligible for a bungalow, and a team of officials will be sent on Monday to begin the eviction process.

22.title: South Korean Air Force planes collide in mid-air; 4 killed
22.article_body: Two South Korean Air Force planes collided in mid-air during a training exercise on Friday, killing all four people aboard the aircraft, officials said. Both planes had taken off from an Air Force base in Sacheon city one after another for flight training. The collision occurred about five minutes after the first aircraft took off, the Air Force said.

23.title: Chris Evans & Scarlett to reunite for 'Project Artemis', Bateman to direct
23.article_body: Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson are all set to star in 'Project Artemis', an upcoming Apple drama which will be directed by 'Ozark' actor Jason Bateman. According to Deadline, the project is set against the space race. Evans and Scarlett have worked together on several projects, including 'Avengers' and 'Captain America: Civil War'.

24.title: PWD to put roof covers on Pragati Maidan's tunnel in Delhi
24.article_body: The PWD has decided to install roof covers on the 1.36 kilometre-long Delhi's Pragati Maidan tunnel and six underpasses to avoid waterlogging, an official said. Notably, roof covers are being planned for all upcoming tunnels in Delhi, the official said. The tunnel, which will have an 80-metre-long and 5-metre-wide emergency lane, is being built to decongest the traffic.

25.title: Electricity tariffs increased by 2.68% in Uttarakhand: UERC
25.article_body: Electricity tariffs have been increased by 2.68% in the state, Uttarakhand Electricity Regulatory Commission (UERC) confirmed. The electricity rate has been hiked by ₹0.4 per unit for BPL and snowbound consumers, UERC informed. Accordingly, the revised domestic electricity rates are ₹2.90, ₹4.20, ₹5.80, ₹6.55 for 0-100 units, 101-200 units, 201-400 units, above 400 units categories, respectively.

26.title: Illegal business expenses of ₹800 crore found at Hero MotoCorp: I-T Dept
26.article_body: The Income Tax Department found illegal business expenses of over ₹800 crore after it conducted a search and seizure operation at Hero MotoCorp's premises. It said that ₹60 crore in "unaccounted" cash was used to purchase 10 acre of farm land in Delhi. "The ultimate...beneficiary of the land deal is a prominent person of the automobile manufacturer group," it added.

27.title: CSK could have won if dropped catches vs LSG were taken: Ravindra Jadeja
27.article_body: Reacting to CSK losing their first two matches of an IPL season for the first time ever after a defeat against LSG, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said they could have won if two catches dropped were taken. Moeen Ali dropped Quinton De Kock, while Tushar Deshpande failed to complete KL Rahul's catch during the match.

28.title: After Bombay HC order, provisional aggregator licence issued to Ola, Uber
28.article_body: Four cab service companies, including Ola and Uber, have been issued a provisional aggregator licence for operating taxi services in the city by  Mumbai Metropolitan Region Transport Authority (MMRTA). Notably, last month, the Bombay High Court had instructed all app-based cab aggregators to apply for a valid licence, after finding them without one, to continue operations in the city.

29.title: Telangana makes wearing masks optional, removes all COVID-19 curbs
29.article_body: In view of declining COVID-19 cases over the past few weeks, the Telangana government on Friday lifted all COVID-19-related restrictions in the state. The state government has announced that wearing face masks will be optional with effect from April 1. However, it has asked pregnant women, senior citizens and people with co-morbidities to continue following the COVID-19 guidelines.

30.title: Adani gains $21 billion in 3 months, more than the world's 5 richest men
30.article_body: Asia's second richest person and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's fortune has surged by $21.1 billion so far this year, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. He made more money than the world's five richest people, including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and Warren Buffett, in three months. Meanwhile, Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's fortune surged $8.24 billion in the same period.

31.title: Kangana praises Rajamouli's 'RRR', says 'nationalism is my favourite subject'
31.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has praised SS Rajamouli's latest film 'RRR', saying that it has everything that a film should have. Calling it an amazing film, she added, "Nationalism is my favourite subject." "This is a blockbuster movie that we've watched in 3D after a long time, long live Rajamouli," Kangana further said. 'RRR' stars Jr NTR, Ram Charan and Alia Bhatt.

32.title: '360-degree player' Badoni is a great find for Indian cricket: Rahul
32.article_body: Talking about Ayush Badoni who helped LSG record their maiden win in IPL history with an unbeaten 19 off 9 balls against CSK, KL Rahul said Badoni is a great find for Indian cricket. "Badoni's been phenomenal. He's strong, a 360-degree player who can bowl," added Rahul. LSG defeated CSK by six wickets after being handed a target of 211.

33.title: Trainee DSP's wife dies by suicide less than 4 months after marriage in UP
33.article_body: A trainee Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP)'s wife allegedly died by suicide in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur less than four months after their marriage, police said. The 30-year-old woman was found hanging from a ceiling fan in a room of their residence, police added. She was pursuing a Bachelor of Ayurvedic Medicine and Surgery (BAMS) from Lucknow, SP Vipin Mishra said.

34.title: Govt not planning a law soon to regulate cryptocurrencies: Report
34.article_body: The government isn't planning a law soon to either regulate or tighten provisions relating to cryptocurrencies, Bloomberg reported on Friday. The Indian government will frame a law for cryptocurrencies only after a global consensus emerges on regulating such assets, the report added. During the Budget, the government announced a 30% tax on income from virtual digital assets from April 1.

35.title: Russia warns agriculture supplies could be limited to 'friends'
35.article_body: Deputy Secretary of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, warned that Russia, a major global wheat exporter, could limit supplies of agriculture products to only "friendly" countries amid Western sanctions imposed on Moscow over the Ukraine invasion.  "Fortunately, we have plenty of them [friendly countries], and they are not in Europe or North America at all," the former President added.

36.title: Russia jamming commercial planes' satellite navigation: France
36.article_body: France's civil aviation authority DGAC has claimed Russia's military has been jamming satellite navigation systems used by commercial aircraft since the Ukraine invasion. Pilots have been reporting disruptions in regions around the Black Sea, eastern Finland and the Kaliningrad enclave. The equipment typically used to protect troops and installations against GPS-guided missiles is being targeted.

37.title: Uber & Google PMs to teach Product Management bootcamp: Masters’ Union
37.article_body: Masters’ Union has announced that in collaboration with product managers (PMs) from Uber, Google, Spinny and other top startups, it is launching a four-month intensive PM Bootcamp. It added that average CTCs recorded are up to ₹45 lakh and in addition to placement, the hands-on bootcamp will strictly focus on prototyping, wireframing, analytics, product-led growth and portfolio development.

38.title: First complete, gapless human genome sequence published
38.article_body: The Telomere-to-Telomere consortium of scientists has published the first complete, gapless sequence of a human genome. This comes two decades after Human Genome Project produced the first draft human genome sequence. Scientists say that having a complete sequence of the roughly 3 billion bases (or 'letters') in our DNA will help them understand all the functional nuances of human genome.

39.title: It doesn’t matter who you are playing with: Badoni on learnings at LSG
39.article_body: Sharing the lessons he has learnt at LSG, batter Ayush Badoni said, "The best thing I have learnt...is to be yourself. Be natural and...it doesn't matter who you are playing with or against." Badoni scored an unbeaten 19 off 9 balls in LSG's match against CSK, having scored 54 off 41 balls in the franchise's IPL 2022 opener against GT.

40.title: When will PM Modi hold 'Pareshani Pe Charcha': NCP on fuel price hike
40.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) criticised PM Narendra Modi over fuel price hike and unemployment and asked when will he organise 'Parseshani Pe Charcha (interaction on hardships)'. "Students are under stress during the exam period. We thank PM for interacting with them...But when is he going to hold 'Pareshani Pe Charcha' to address concerns...of common people?" NCP's Clyde Crasto said.

41.title: Pune civic body registers record revenue collection in 2021-22
41.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation registered a record revenue collection in the year 2021-22, which included ₹2,002 crore collected as building development charges and ₹1,845.91 crore as property taxes. The civic body had collected ₹508 crore in 2020-21 and ₹770 crore in 2019-20 as building development charges. An official said that 70% of the people paid their property taxes online.

42.title: Australia to send armoured vehicles requested by Ukrainian Prez
42.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison said the country would send armoured Bushmaster vehicles to Ukraine. This comes after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy specifically asked for them during an address to the Australian Parliament on Thursday. Morrison added that Australia is "not just sending our prayers" but "we're sending our guns...our munitions...humanitarian aid" and more to war-hit Ukraine.

43.title: Bajrang Dal activists assault Muslim man for selling halal meat in Karnataka
43.article_body: A group of Bajrang Dal activists allegedly assaulted a Muslim vendor in Karnataka's Bhadravathi for selling halal meat at his chicken shop, police said. An FIR has been registered and police have initiated a probe in this connection. The incident comes a day after CM Basavaraj S Bommai said he will look into serious objections raised against halal meat.

44.title: Choreographer Ganesh Acharya charged with stalking, voyeurism, sexual harassment
44.article_body: The Mumbai Police have filed a chargesheet against choreographer Ganesh Acharya, who was booked for alleged sexual harassment in 2020. Acharya has been charged with stalking, sexual harassment and voyeurism. A complaint was filed in 2020 by a choreographer working with Acharya alleging that he had sexually harassed her after she turned down his advances

45.title: Hyderabad Police arrests Nigerian national in ₹12.48 crore bank hacking case
45.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested a Nigerian national for being involved in a fraudulent transfer from Andhra Pradesh Mahesh Cooperative Urban Bank of ₹12.48 crore by hacking a bank server. Hyderabad Police Commissioner said the bank and the software company used by them for banking security will also be added as co-accused in the case for not following proper security measures.

46.title: Blue Origin makes 4th manned spaceflight, lands crew after 10 minutes
46.article_body: Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin successfully completed its fourth manned mission, with six crew members, to space on Thursday. The crew was landed safely back on Earth 10 minutes after the launch in the US. Earlier, comedian Pete Davidson had been confirmed as a non-paying promotional guest on the six-member flight, but he dropped out later.

47.title: 'X' gender marker to be available for passports in US from April 11
47.article_body: The US government marked Transgender Day of Visibility by announcing that US citizens will be able to select 'X' as the gender marker on their passport applications from April 11. The definition of 'X' gender marker will be "unspecified or another gender identity", it said. The move intends to make federal documents more inclusive for transgender, non-binary and gender-nonconforming people.

48.title: Three members of a family found murdered in Chhattisgarh: Police
48.article_body: Three members of a family, related to each other as mother, son and granddaughter aged 60, 30 and 15, respectively, were allegedly found murdered in a tribal area in Chhattisgarh's Raigad. They were attacked with sharp weapons and crushed to death with stones, police said. They had started living in the forest last month to collect Mahua and other products.

49.title: Gujarat schoolgirl fights off knife-wielding robber; saves sister
49.article_body: An 18-year-old student was injured after she allegedly fought off a robber who put a knife to her throat and saved her sister in Gujarat's Surat. Reportedly, a robber threatened the girl, who was awake due to exams, with a knife while another attempted to attack her sister. The girl apparently pushed knife away and pulled her sister near herself.

50.title: Putin shouldn't be allowed to attend G20 summit: Canadian PM
50.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said he opposes Russian President Vladimir Putin's attendance at 2022 G20 summit in Bali. "Russia has with its illegal invasion of Ukraine upended economic growth for everyone around the world and can't possibly be a constructive partner in how we manage the crisis," he added. Trudeau said he shared his view with Indonesian President Joko Widodo.

51.title: Retaining Russell a large gamble, his bowling a big question mark: Jaffer
51.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said KKR took a large gamble by retaining Andre Russell, adding that it is a big question mark whether he can bowl with the same pace and energy. "Russell was limbering up in his last two overs [while bowling against RCB]," stated Jaffer. Russell conceded 36 runs in 2.2 overs against RCB.

52.title: Dalit student kills self after harassment over non-payment of fees in TN
52.article_body: A 19-year-old Dalit college student in Tamil Nadu’s Nagapattinam killed herself at her home after allegedly being depressed due to harassment over non-payment of college fees, the police said. The deceased identified as Subashini was a physiotherapy student. The girl's relatives and friends blocked road outside Nagapattinam hospital and demanded arrest of correspondent, principal and a  lecturer.

53.title: Guj man arrested for murdering wife, 2 kids, relative; had planned to kill another
53.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife, two teenage children and his wife's grandmother in Gujarat. Police said the accused suspected his wife of having an affair with her boss at a factory. As per reports, the accused had also planned to kill his mother-in-law, but was allegedly shaken after committing four murders and hence spared her.

54.title: Malaika dances with Harnaaz Sandhu on 'Chaiyya Chaiyya', video surfaces
54.article_body: A video of Malaika Arora dancing with Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Sandhu on the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' from the film 'Dil Se' has surfaced online. They performed on 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' at Josh Wakao, an influencer fest held in Mumbai. The original song, sung by Sukhwinder Singh and Sapna Awasthi, featured Shah Rukh Khan and Malaika.

55.title: Speeding vehicle kills pedestrian in Mohali
55.article_body: A pedestrian was killed in a hit and run accident near Balongi in Mohali on Thursday. An onlooker, Jarnail Singh, told the police that a speeding car had hit the pedestrian from behind and sped away. The victim was taken to a hospital in Chandigarh where he eventually died, police said. The unidentified driver is being traced by the police.

56.title: Tesla-rival Rivian lists Ukraine war as reason for 'delays' in ops
56.article_body: Tesla-rival Rivian has blamed the Ukrainian war and the ongoing pandemic and inflation, for "disruptions to and delays" in operations, a regulatory filing revealed. It also counted the conflict as a factor in higher component costs which it said have risen "considerably". In total, Rivian made 13 references to Ukraine in the filing.

57.title: Jamia students stage protest demanding complete reopening of campus
57.article_body: On Thursday, many students from Delhi's Jamia Millia Islamia staged a protest in campus, demanding the complete reopening of the college. They have demanded offline classes for students of all semesters as well as access to the central and departmental libraries for all. Jamia resumed offline classes for undergraduate and postgraduate final year students in March this year.

58.title: Guwahati civic polls postponed to April 21 due to Rongali Bihu festival
58.article_body: The Assam State Election Commission on Thursday postponed the Guwahati Municipal Corporation (GMC) elections to April 21 in view of the Rongali Bihu festival, which will be celebrated from April 14. This comes after several political parties submitted representations to the EC seeking postponement. As per the revised schedule, the counting of votes will now be held on April 24.

59.title: Juvenile found guilty of rioting 20 years later in 2002 Gujarat riots case
59.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who was 15 years old in 2002, has been found guilty of rioting 20 years later in Gulbarg Housing Society massacre during Gujarat riots. A Juvenile Justice Board found him guilty of being part of a mob that attacked the housing society. As many as 69 people, including a former Congress MP, were killed in the massacre.

60.title: Deverakonda, Puri meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh after announcing JGM
60.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, director Puri Jagannadh and the team of 'JGM' met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Delhi on March 30. Producer Charmme Kaur shared some pictures from their meeting on her Twitter handle, along with a caption that read, "Team #JGM meets honourable Defence Minister of India, Rajnath Singh ji." Deverakonda and Charmme had announced the film on March 29.

61.title: Whatever happens offline, same takes place online: PM during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'
61.article_body: Interacting with students, parents and teachers during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' 2022, PM Narendra Modi said that whatever happens offline, the same takes place online. "This means the medium is not the problem. Irrespective of the medium, if our mind is delved into the subject, then it won't make a difference in grasping things," he added.

62.title: Nitish will not leave Bihar: JDU rejects speculation of him going to RS
62.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) refuted rumours of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar going to Rajya Sabha and said that Nitish will not leave Bihar. Taking to Twitter, JDU leader Sanjay Kumar Jha, said, "Shri Kumar has people's mandate to serve Bihar, and will continue to do so for the full term as Chief Minister. He is not going anywhere."

63.title: India voice of developing nations on climate change: Environment Min
63.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said India has emerged as the voice of developing nations on climate change issues. "India is among...few countries that not only set Nationally Determined Contributions in 2015 but achieved them before time," Yadav said in Lok Sabha. He further added that India's lifestyle can teach the world how to live in harmony with the environment.

64.title: What are the income tax rule changes effective from today?
64.article_body: Income from virtual digital assets (VDAs) will be taxed at 30% and losses incurred from one VDA can't be set off against income from another VDA. A cap of tax-free contributions up to ₹2.5 lakh will be imposed on Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) account. A surcharge on long term capital gains tax will be capped at 15% for all assets.

65.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to release in UAE with 0 cuts, director says 'Big victory'
65.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' will release in UAE on April 7. Director Vivek Agnihotri, who had claimed that the film had been "banned" in the country, expressed his happiness on Twitter, writing, "Big victory: Finally, got...censor clearance from UAE." In a statement, Vivek said while some people in India are calling it Islamophobic, an Islamic country passed it with zero cuts.

66.title: Startup founder flags bad roads in B'luru, Telangana Minister says 'move to Hyderabad'
66.article_body: Khatabook's Founder Ravish Naresh tweeted that despite startups in Bengaluru's HSR Layout and Koramangala generating billions of dollars in taxes, the areas' roads are bad and there were power cuts almost daily. "Many rural areas now have better basic infra than India's Silicon Valley," he wrote. Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao replied saying, "Pack your bags and move to Hyderabad."

67.title: Ask yourself when you study online, do you really study or watch reels: PM to students
67.article_body: Addressing students during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha', Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Ask yourself when you study online, do you really study or watch reels on social media?" PM Modi added that it is not the fault of online or offline education because it doesn't matter where you are, but how focused your mind is during the classes.

68.title: Over 16,000 Indian pilgrims visited Pakistan in last 5 yrs: Centre
68.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan informed Rajya Sabha that 16,831 Indian pilgrims visited Pakistan, while 2,119 Pakistani pilgrims visited India, from 2017 to 2021. According to the data, the highest annual number of Indian pilgrims who travelled to Pakistan was in 2021 (5,425), while the highest number of Pakistani pilgrims who came here was in 2017 (984).

69.title: Karnataka court orders probe against BJP minister over hate speech
69.article_body: A court ordered Karnataka Police to conduct a probe against BJP leader and Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister KS Eshwarappa over alleged hate speech. Eshwarappa had suggested that Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killers were Muslims, following which a complaint was filed. Such statements were made with the intention of creating enmity between Hindus and Muslims, as per the complaint.

70.title: Binance wins dismissal of US lawsuit over digital token sales
70.article_body: A US judge has dismissed a lawsuit accusing Binance of violating securities laws by selling unregistered tokens and failing to register as an exchange or broker-dealer. Digital token investors, who had bought nine tokens through Binance starting in 2017, claimed Binance failed to warn them about the "significant risks" of the purchase. The judge said the investors sued too late.

71.title: Man fined $7.2 million over 'Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist'
71.article_body: Canada's Supreme Court asked a man behind the 'Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist' to pay over C$9 million ($7.2 million) fine. Richard Vallières was found guilty in 2016 of trafficking, fraud, and theft of maple syrup worth over $14.4 million between 2011 and 2012. Vallières, at trial, had said he'd sold syrup for $8 million and made an $800,000 profit.

72.title: Bhagwant Mann moves resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab
72.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday moved a resolution in the state Assembly, seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab "for maintaining harmony and taking sentiments of people into account". "Chandigarh city was created as the capital of Punjab. In all past precedents, whenever a state has been divided, the capital remains with the parent state," the resolution stated.

73.title: Making anyone but Harmanpreet captain means repeating a mistake: Anjum
73.article_body: Ex-India captain Anjum Chopra said Harmanpreet Kaur should be India's captain across formats, adding that making anyone else the captain will be a mistake being repeated. Harmanpreet is currently the captain in T20Is with Mithali Raj leading India in ODIs and Test cricket. "Harmanpreet's aggressive approach brings the best out of the Indian team," stated Anjum.

74.title: Didn't share OTP but still lost ₹3.63 lakh: Mumbai woman tells police
74.article_body: A 25-year-old Mumbai-based woman allegedly lost ₹3.63 lakh to cyber fraud and claimed before the police that she did not share OTP with the fraudster who called her impersonating as a bank official. The victim further told the police that the man asked her to confirm if her number is linked to her net banking account and asked for OTP.

75.title: He played a hell of a knock, unbelievable: De Kock on Evin's 23-ball 55*
75.article_body: LSG opener Quinton De Kock termed batter Evin Lewis's 23-ball 55* against CSK as a hell of a knock and unbelievable, adding that Ayush Badoni's 9-ball 19* was as impressive. "We came out fighting and to come out on top is always special," stated De Kock. LSG recorded their maiden win in IPL history after beating CSK by six wickets.

76.title: Gautam Gambhir's reaction after LSG's win against CSK goes viral
76.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) mentor Gautam Gambhir's reaction after LSG's victory against CSK has gone viral on social media. Gambhir was seen jumping from his chair and throwing a punch in the air as soon as Ayush Badoni hit the winning runs. LSG chased down a target of 211 to win the match.

77.title: There's no truth to this: US on Pak PM's claim of 'foreign conspiracy' to oust him
77.article_body: The US has rejected Pakistan PM Imran Khan's allegations regarding US' role in a "foreign conspiracy" to oust him from power. "There's no truth to these allegations...We respect...Pakistan's constitutional process and the rule of law," the US State Department said. Earlier, Khan, during a speech, named US as the country that threatened them, but immediately retracted its name.

78.title: Police offered to arrest Will Smith, but Chris Rock said 'No, no, no': Oscars producer
78.article_body: Oscars producer Will Packer has said that Los Angeles police were ready to arrest Will Smith after he slapped Chris Rock during the Oscar ceremony. "They said we will go get him...We’re prepared to get him right now. Chris was like, 'No, no, no, I'm fine',"  Packer said. Will had slapped Chris for making a joke about his wife Jada.

79.title: 67-year-old woman from Mumbai loses ₹20 lakh to Bitcoin cyber fraud
79.article_body: A 67-year-old woman from Mumbai lost ₹20 lakh to cyber fraudsters impersonating as employees of a company dealing in Bitcoin investments. She said she saw an advertisement for Bitcoins on her phone and had clicked on the link out of curiosity. She realised she had been defrauded after the accused claimed her invested money was lost due to Ukraine-Russia war.

80.title: Over 35,000 cases involving Centre, state govts pending in SC: Centre
80.article_body: Addressing the  Parliament, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that over 35,000 cases involving the Centre and state governments have been pending in Supreme Court since 2017. Rijiju further informed that Centre's 1,807 cases are pending in the apex court and  it is the respondent in 6,104 pending cases. State governments are respondents in 20,637 pending cases, he further added.

81.title: HC summons BESCOM MD to explain delay in shifting transformers
81.article_body: Karnataka High Court has directed Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) Managing Director (MD) to appear before it on April 7 to explain the delay in shifting transformers from public footpaths. This comes after a father and his daughter were killed in a BESCOM transformer blast earlier this month. Transformers on footpaths "put the public at risk", the court said.

82.title: Section 144 imposed in UP's GB Nagar till April 30 in view of festivals, exams
82.article_body: Section 144 has been imposed in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district till April 30, the Police Commissionerate said. The order was passed keeping in view the upcoming festivals like Ramzan, Ram Navami, high school examinations and the General Legislative Council Election 2022. People will have to follow COVID-19 protocols in public places, the order stated.

83.title: Vehicular traffic to be shut for 6 hrs at Pune's Sinhagad Fort
83.article_body: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has ordered the closure of vehicular traffic from 6 am to 12 pm tomorrow at the Sinhagad Fort for an Indian Army event. The Army is organising the 'Narveer Tanaji Run'. As many as 352 people, including Army personnel and civilians, will be participating in the run which is from Rajgad Fort to Sinhagad Fort.

84.title: There's indication Putin is self-isolating, punishing advisers: Biden
84.article_body: US President Joe Biden said Russian President Vladimir Putin "seems to be self-isolating" amid the Ukraine war. "There's some indication that he has fired or put under house arrest some of his advisers," Biden added. "But I don't want to put too much stock in that at this time because we don't have that much hard evidence," he further said.

85.title: Amitabh Bachchan visits Rishikesh, performs puja and aarti at ghat
85.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan recently visited Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, and took part in religious rituals. Several pictures and videos of him doing puja have surfaced online. Amitabh was also seen doing Parmarth Ganga Aarti with Swami Chidanand Saraswati. "Ganga provokes divinity...embraces the soul in a way no other can...and emotes in a manner unknown to mankind," he wrote on his blog.

86.title: It plays on a batter's mind: Sandeep on dismissing Kohli most times in IPL
86.article_body: Talking about dismissing Virat Kohli seven times in the IPL which is the most number of times someone has dismissed him in the tournament, ex-SRH pacer Sandeep Sharma said it does play on a batter's mind. "You must have noticed them playing such bowlers with...more care," added Sandeep. Sandeep recently bowled against Kohli in PBKS' IPL 2022 opener against RCB.

87.title: Hyd Police extends discount on pending traffic challans till April 15
87.article_body: The Hyderabad Police has extended the deadline for one-time discount on pending traffic challans  till April 15. Earlier, a deadline of March 31 was set for the same. Under the scheme, two-wheelers are given a 75% discount on pending challans, whereas 50% discount is being given to car owners. "Utilise this opportunity and clear your pending challans," Hyderabad Police tweeted.

88.title: Woman arrested for pushing 16-yr-old girl into prostitution in Mumbai
88.article_body: The Anti-Human Trafficking Cell arrested a woman for allegedly pushing a 16-year-old girl into prostitution in Mumbai. The Mira Bhayandar Vasai Virar (MBVV) Police used a decoy customer to trap the accused, who brought the minor to a bus stand outside Mira Road railway station. As soon as the woman accepted ₹15,000 in exchange for the service, she was arrested.

89.title: Telangana govt advises citizens to stay indoors from 12-4 pm amid heatwave alert
89.article_body: The Telangana government has advised citizens to stay indoors between 12 pm and 4 pm, in view of the continuous rise in temperature in the state. "The temperature will be high during this time and there are chances of sunstroke," state Director of Public Health G Srinivas Rao said. The IMD has issued an orange alert regarding heatwaves, Rao added.

90.title: Rash driver given bail, told to assist ward boys at TN hospital for 30 days
90.article_body: Madras High Court has granted bail to a man on the condition that he assists ward boys at Government Stanley Hospital in Tamil Nadu's Chennai for 30 days and writes a note on his experience daily. The man is accused of rash driving in an illegal bike racing case. The accused claimed that he was riding pillion and wasn't racing.

91.title: Cong suspends 2 MLAs for violating party's whip, cross-voting in RS elections
91.article_body: The Congress in Assam has suspended two of its MLAs for violating the party's whip and cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha elections. The party suspended its Karimganj South MLA Siddeque Ahmed for writing 'ONE' instead of numeric 1 which led to the cancellation of his vote and also suspended MLA Sashi Kanta Das for voting in favour of BJP.

92.title: Food delivery man held for theft in Mumbai was in jail for 5-yr-old's murder
92.article_body: The Kurar Police had recently arrested a 29-year-old man associated with a food delivery app in relation to theft of e-commerce parcels in Mumbai's Malad. However, on further investigation, the police found out that the man had been convicted in the murder case of a five-year-old boy. The accused was reportedly out on parole when he was arrested.

93.title: Rajkot International Airport expected to be functional by Aug-Sep
93.article_body: The Hirasar Airport or Rajkot Greenfield International Airport is expected to be functional by August or September 2022, the Rajkot District Magistrate said. "There is very good progress in the construction work. About 85% of work on the runway is complete," he added. Located 30 kilometres from the Rajkot industrial city, the airport will cover an area of 1,032 hectares.

94.title: Won't allow Chinese military base, know ramification: Solomon Islands
94.article_body: The Solomon Islands said it'd not allow China to establish a military base in the Pacific islands nation despite its plans to sign a security pact with Beijing. "Government is conscious of the security ramification of hosting a military base, and it'll not be careless to allow such initiative to take place under its watch," PM Manasseh Sogavare's office said.

95.title: I didn't like what I saw, Dhoni was running the whole game: Ajay Jadeja on CSK-LSG match
95.article_body: Talking about CSK's defeat against LSG, former India batter Ajay Jadeja said, "CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja was standing right there, but MS Dhoni continued to run the whole game." He added, "I didn't like what I saw today." Ajay stated, "Dhoni was wrong in taking over today. If Ravindra was even beginning to feel confident about his captaincy...he won't now."

96.title: Sequoia India MD's 15-year-old son builds app for Ukraine refugees to find help
96.article_body: Sequoia India MD GV Ravi Shankar's 15-year-old son Tejas has built an app for Ukrainian refugees in neighbouring countries to get help from locals offering to assist them. He built the app in two weeks. The app includes a map to find closest help locations, verification features based on national IDs across the world and listings offering necessities like food.

97.title: Govt extends AFSPA in 'disturbed areas' of 9 Nagaland and 3 Arunachal districts
97.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Friday issued a notification enlisting nine districts in Nagaland as "disturbed areas", where Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA) will continue to remain imposed for another six months, unless withdrawn earlier. In another notification, the MHA has extended AFSPA in Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap, Changlang and Longding districts from April 1 to September 30.

98.title: Delhi records 2nd highest average minimum temp in March in 72 years
98.article_body: Delhi in 2022 recorded the second-highest average minimum temperature in March in 72 years at 17.6°C, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD). From 1951 to 2022, the highest average minimum temperature recorded in March in Delhi was 18.5°C in 1953 and 2010, IMD's senior scientist RK Jenamani said. The average maximum temperature in March 2022 was 32.9°C.

99.title: BMC plans to build flyover above Goregaon Creek to ease connectivity
99.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has proposed to build a flyover over Goregaon Creek in Mumbai. The flyover is expected to decongest primary arterial roads in the city and help ease connectivity in areas of Oshiwara, Jogeshwari and Andheri East. According to BMC, a portion of slum shanties in Bhagat Singh Nagar will have to be rehabilitated for the project.

100.title: Facebook bug promoted posts with nudity, misinformation for 6 months
100.article_body: A software bug in Facebook led to a heavy distribution of posts containing nudity, violence, and false information reviewed by independent third-party fact-checkers in Feed, over the past six months. Facebook's system also failed to properly demote even Russian state media posts. The technical issue was first introduced in 2019 but didn't create a noticeable impact until October 2021.

101.title: Excise department seizes 8,500 litres of spirit in Kerala; 3 arrested
101.article_body: Three people were arrested after the excise department seized 8,500 litres of spirit from Kalamassery and Edayar areas in Kerala's Ernakulam. They recovered 243 cans of spirit from a small truck and underground cabin of a paint manufacturing company. One of the accused traded spirit under the guise of the paint and biodiesel industry, an excise department official said.

102.title: Fire destroys over 20 homes in Srinagar; 37 families left homeless
102.article_body: A massive fire that broke out in Srinagar's Noor Bagh has destroyed over 20 houses and buildings and left at least 37 families homeless, officials said. The fire had erupted on Wednesday night and four people, including a firefighter, who were injured in the incident have been hospitalised. Essential assistance along with ₹1.85 lakh has been given to the families.

103.title: Salman Khan is the biggest action star in India: 'RRR' actor Jr NTR
103.article_body: Jr NTR, in an interview, said that Salman Khan is "the biggest action star in the country". "I've been his fan for a very long time," he added. Talking about how Salman supported 'RRR' by appearing at the film's launch event, he said, "It was so sweet of him...A star of that stature. We're like youngsters in front of him."

104.title: Kohli, Rohit don't like getting out to bowlers part of Team India: Ashwin
104.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin said he enjoys competing against Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the IPL, as they don't like being dismissed by bowlers who are a part of Team India. Talking about his former franchise CSK, Ashwin stated he believes that the dressing room continues to be magical and midas due to the presence of MS Dhoni.

105.title: BJP creating poisonous atmosphere through 'The Kashmir..': Pawar
105.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday accused BJP of creating a "poisonous atmosphere" by spreading "false propaganda" about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits through the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. He said that such a movie "shouldn't have been cleared for screening", but is given tax concessions. "Pakistan-based terror groups were responsible for...attacks on Kashmiri Pandits and Muslims," he added.

106.title: Dead bodies of man, woman found in well in Rajasthan village
106.article_body: Dead bodies of a man and woman were found in a well on Thursday in Raipura village in Rajasthan, police said. The dead body of the man was said to be around 10 days old, police added. Only a skeleton was left of the woman, who was speculated to have died two-three months ago, police further said.

107.title: BMC approves pre-monsoon work of ₹545 crore for Mumbai
107.article_body: In a move to prepare Mumbai for the monsoon, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) approved proposals worth ₹545 crore. Out of the total amount, ₹162 crore are for desilting of stormwater drains and ₹383 crore are for reinstating trenches along roads. BMC shared the information after BJP criticised it saying that contractors will have less time to complete pre-monsoon work.

108.title: India reports 1,335 new COVID-19 cases, active cases fall to 13,672
108.article_body: India has reported 1,335 new COVID-19 cases and 52 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 1,225 cases and 28 deaths. The country's active cases have declined to 13,672, while COVID-19 death toll reached 5,21,181. Over 1,900 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours.

109.title: 9 members of wedding procession killed, 4 injured as SUV falls into gorge in J&K
109.article_body: Nine members of a wedding procession died and four others were injured after the SUV they were travelling in fell into a deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Thursday evening. "The vehicle was overloaded beyond its authorised capacity of seven. Prima facie, it appears that the vehicle carrying 13 people was being driven negligently," a police officer said.

110.title: I don't have dementia, Ranbir is entitled to say what he wants: Randhir Kapoor
110.article_body: After Ranbir Kapoor said in a recent interview that his uncle Randhir Kapoor is in an early stage of dementia, the veteran actor said that he doesn't have dementia. "I am perfectly fine. I just had COVID-19 sometime ago." On being asked why Ranbir said it, Randhir replied, "It's Ranbir's wish. He is entitled to say what he wants."

111.title: LPG cylinder for commercial use gets costlier by ₹250 from today
111.article_body: The price of commercial LPG cylinders has been hiked by ₹250 with effect from today. With the latest hike, a 19-kg commercial cylinder will now cost ₹2,253 in Delhi, ₹2,205 in Mumbai, ₹2,351.5 in Kolkata and ₹2,406 in Chennai. However, the domestic LPG cylinder rates and petrol and diesel prices were kept unchanged on Friday.

112.title: Kyiv not Kiev, reject outdated Soviet spelling of our cities: Ukraine Prez
112.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the correct spelling of the country's capital is "Kyiv" and "not Kiev". "[It's] high time to finally discard the outdated Soviet spelling of our cities and adopt the correct Ukrainian form," he said. Zelenskyy thanked Japan's government for deciding to refer to the Ukrainian capital as "Kiiu", the Japanese transliteration of the Ukrainian spelling "Kyiv".

113.title: Sanders compares Bezos & Musk's 'joy rides to space' to oligarchy, video goes viral
113.article_body: US Senator Bernie Sanders in a recent speech said, "Anyone who thinks we don't have...oligarchy right here in America is sorely mistaken." "Multi-billionaires like Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, Richard Branson are off taking joy rides on their rocket ships to outer space," he added. "They're buying $500 million superyachts. And we talk about the yachts...Putin's friends have," Sanders stated.

114.title: I've not met anyone who said it's a bad film: Abhishek on Kashmir Files
114.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan has said 'The Kashmir Files' has worked at the box office because it's a good film. "If [it] wasn't good, it wouldn't have worked," he said. Abhishek, however, added that he hasn't seen the film yet. "But I've not met anybody who said it's a bad film...If a film does good business, it has to be...good," he stated.

115.title: UP CM directs officials to give govt jobs to 10,000 youths in 100 days
115.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed the state service selection boards to give government jobs to more than 10,000 youths in the next 100 days. "UP government is committed to connecting youths with government jobs...providing them employment," Adityanath said. "CM directed officials to explore the use of technology...reduce paper leak incidents to almost nil," an official said.

116.title: Mumbai Police officer booked for not submitting documents in 5 cases
116.article_body: A case has been registered by Mumbai's Kasturba Marg Police against one of its own officers for not submitting documents related to five cases. The accused Anil Sonavane is wanted in a robbery case. From 2015-2016, he was given the charge of an investigating officer in cases related to theft, child labour, unlawful labour, rash driving and road accidents.

117.title: US warned firms about Russia's Kaspersky day after invasion: Report
117.article_body: The US government started privately warning some firms that Russia could manipulate Kaspersky's software to cause harm, the day after Russian invasion, Reuters reported. The US fears Kaspersky's Russian staff could be coerced into helping establish remote access to their users' computers. Kaspersky said briefings about purported risks of its software would be "further damaging" to its reputation.

118.title: International flight departures from B'luru increases from 10 to 25
118.article_body: The Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) in Bengaluru has increased the international flight departure from 10 flights each day to 25 after the government removed restrictions on international flights. Currently, 24 airlines operate to 21 international destinations  in 17 countries from KIA. Before COVID-19 pandemic, there used to be 40 international departures each day from Bengaluru.

119.title: Kharar man kills wife, dumps her body in a canal; arrested
119.article_body: A man from Punjab's Kharar was arrested for allegedly killing his wife and dumping her body in a canal near Morinda. The woman went missing on March 9, following which her sister had filed a missing person's report. During interrogation, the accused confessed to have killed his wife after she confronted him about his extra-marital affair with a Ludhiana-based woman.

120.title: UP police threaten to raze 2 rape accused's houses with bulldozer
120.article_body: Uttar Pradesh police on Thursday threatened two rape accused, saying that they'll raze their houses if the duo doesn't surrender within 24 hours. The duo, who're both from Saharanpur's Chilkana village, had raped a minor girl a week ago and were absconding, a senior police official said. Police had made the threat after reaching the accused's houses with a bulldozer.

121.title: Hyderabad Metro to offer unlimited travel with holiday card for ₹59 from April 2
121.article_body: Hyderabad Metro is going to launch a Super Saver Metro Holiday Card from Ugadi on April 2, which offers unlimited travel across 57 stations and three corridors on 100 days including Sundays, second and fourth Saturdays and government holidays. Passengers can buy the card from any ticket counter by paying a non-refundable cost of ₹50 and top-up value of ₹59.

122.title: UP man awarded 10-yr jail for raping minor niece in Mohali
122.article_body: Mohali's local court sentenced an Uttar Pradesh-based man to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping his niece in May 2015. The convict had raped the minor, studying in class six when she was alone at her home. He also threatened her against speaking up. But she raised an alarm when he made another rape bid the next day.

123.title: LSG's Ayush Badoni's six hits female spectator's head, video goes viral
123.article_body: A video has gone viral showing LSG's Ayush Badoni's 85-metre six on the bowling of CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube hitting a female spectator's head in the stands. In the video, the woman can be seen trying to catch the ball before getting hit on the head. Badoni had hit the six on the first ball of the 19th over.

124.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested in separate cases in Hyderabad
124.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday arrested two drug peddlers and seized eight grams of Dimethyltryptamine (DMT) drug, six LSD blots, 10 ecstasy pills and 100 grams of hash oil from the accused. One of the accused, who used to extract the drug at his residence, was arrested from Jubilee Hills area, police said. While another was arrested from Nallakunta, police added.

125.title: Sri Lanka imposes curfew after protests outside Prez's home turn violent
125.article_body: Police imposed an overnight curfew in several parts of the Sri Lankan capital Colombo as protests outside President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's home, demanding his resignation over the nation's worst economic crisis, turned violent. Police fired tear gas and a water cannon to disperse protesters who blamed Rajapaksa for long power outages and shortages of essentials. "Gota go home," protesters chanted.

126.title: Helmets compulsory for school, college students and govt employees: Pune Collector
126.article_body: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has made it compulsory for school and college students and government employees to wear helmets while riding two-wheelers and commuting to offices or elsewhere. Those found violating the order will face action. "The likelihood of a two-wheeler rider dying in an accident is seven times higher than those travelling in a car," the order stated.

127.title: 3 members of interstate gang arrested after shootout in central Delhi
127.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three members of an interstate gang led by jailed gangsters Lawrence Bishnoi and Virender Pratap alias Kala Rana following a shootout in central Delhi on Thursday evening. The arrested men had come to Delhi from Chandigarh to extort someone, police said. They were involved in several criminal cases in Bihar, Haryana and Punjab, police added.

128.title: LSG's Ayush Badoni's six hits female spectator's head, video goes viral
128.article_body: A video has gone viral showing LSG's Ayush Badoni's 85-metre six on the bowling of CSK fast bowler Mukesh Choudhary hitting a female spectator's head in the stands. In the video, the woman can be seen trying to catch the ball before getting hit on the head. Badoni had hit the six on the first ball of the last over.

129.title: Gurugram witnesses hottest day in March in over 23 years at 41.4°C
129.article_body: Gurugram on Thursday witnessed its hottest day in March in over 23 years at 41.4°C, as per the India Meteorological Department (IMD) data. Gurugram had recorded the highest maximum temperature of 39.5°C in the month of March in 1999. The maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 44°C by April 3, according to IMD's weekly forecast.

130.title: Gambhir catches up with Dhoni after CSK-LSG match, pics go viral
130.article_body: Pictures of Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) mentor Gautam Gambhir meeting former Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni following their teams' IPL 2022 match on Thursday have gone viral. Reacting to the photos, a social media user commented, "Haters will say it's photoshopped." "Two legends in one frame," wrote another. Gambhir had recently rubbished claims that he doesn't like Dhoni.

131.title: Putin's approval rating in Russia surges since start of war, hits 83%
131.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's approval rating among Russians has surged since the start of the war in Ukraine, hitting the highest level since September 2017. A poll by the independent Moscow-based Levada Center found 83% of Russians support Putin's activities as President even as he was widely criticised globally. Meanwhile, 15% of the 1,632 Russians polled didn't support Putin's actions.

132.title: Mumbai very likely to experience above-normal temperatures in April: IMD
132.article_body: As per IMD's extended range forecast for the month of April, Mumbai is very likely to experience above-normal temperatures during the next four weeks. IMD's forecast states Mumbai and its surrounding areas may receive some pre-monsoon showers in April. The daytime temperature could rise to 37°C by April 2. The maximum temperature in Santacruz was recorded at 32.6°C on Thursday.

133.title: Bengaluru police arrest 2 Nigerian nationals, seize ₹20 lakh-MDMA
133.article_body: Bengaluru police's Central Crime Branch has arrested two Nigerian nationals for alleged drug peddling and seized MDMA worth ₹20 lakh from them, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) tweeted on Thursday. The arrest was made within Banasawadi police station limits. Earlier, police had arrested a drug peddler and seized MDMA and a phone worth a total of ₹1.5 lakh.

134.title: Fire breaks out at Pune godown; 4 including 2 firefighters injured
134.article_body: Four people, including at least two firefighters, were injured after a fire broke out at a godown in Pune's Nana Peth on Thursday. At least 12 fire tenders and five ambulances were rushed to the spot after the fire department received a call about the blaze at 11.35 pm. The fire was brought under control around 1 am on Friday.

135.title: 14-yr-old girl, her brother killed after truck hits their bike in Pune
135.article_body: A 14-year-old girl and her 12-year-old brother were killed after a pickup truck allegedly hit their bike near Daund town in the Pune district on Thursday. Officials said the accident took place in the morning when the brother-sister duo were going to their school, adding that the girl was riding the bike. Meanwhile, police have booked the pickup truck driver.

136.title: 23-yr-old BTech graduate dies of alleged drug overdose in Hyderabad
136.article_body: A 23-year-old BTech graduate died of an alleged drug overdose in Hyderabad, police said. Doctors reportedly said that he suffered with multiple sclerosis and strokes and due to drug overdose he died. According to police, the deceased along with a drug-peddler used to frequently visit Goa and consumed multiple drugs like LSD and MDMA. Meanwhile, police have arrested the peddler.

137.title: Banks' consortium releases ₹150 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
137.article_body: The first instalment of ₹150 crore has been released by a consortium of seven banks for completion of stalled Amrapali projects in the NCR. The consortium will be disbursing a total sum of ₹1,500 crore for the construction of over 5,100 units in Amrapali projects in Noida and Greater Noida. Nearly 40,000 homebuyers are awaiting possession in the projects.

138.title: Free Stays or a prank? This April Fools’ Day, find out on app: Goibibo
138.article_body: Goibibo announced that on April 1, when the world expects to be pranked, it has come up with a fun activation to give 'FULL VASOOL' to its consumers. Users can choose a hotel on the app and apply code 'NOFOOL' to find out what's in store for them. Goibibo added that it's seeing many netizens participating in this activation already.

139.title: Airtel offers transparency at a time when customers need it most: Airtel
139.article_body: Airtel aims to reinforce its commitment to honesty and transparency towards its customers. The telco has started sending messages for planned outages, upgradation and resolutions, making it easier for users to deal with network disruptions and plan their schedules accordingly, it revealed. Airtel seeks to prioritise its customers' needs by keeping them informed and improving their experience.

140.title: Anup Soni shares edited video of Crime Patrol after Will Smith's slap at Oscars
140.article_body: Actor Anup Soni took to Twitter to share a viral video meme on Will Smith's slap at Oscars featuring a clip from 'Crime Patrol'. "I knew this will happen," Soni said. In the video, one could see Smith slapping Chris Rock after which Soni's 'Satark rahiye' dialogue is played. "This is universal. Fits everywhere," a user wrote.

141.title: England defeat SA by 137 runs to reach Women's World Cup final for 2nd straight time
141.article_body: England defeated South Africa by 137 runs in the second semi-final to reach Women's World Cup final for the second straight time. Danielle Wyatt top-scored for England with 129 as her team posted a total of 293-8. South Africa were bowled out for 156 with Sophie Ecclestone registering figures of 8-0-36-6.

142.title: Dwayne Bravo becomes highest wicket-taker in IPL history
142.article_body: CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo has become the highest wicket-taker in IPL history. The 38-year-old achieved the feat by taking his tally of wickets in IPL to 171 after dismissing LSG's Deepak Hooda in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. He overtook the previous record held by Lasith Malinga, who had taken 170 wickets in 122 IPL matches.

143.title: CSK lose first 2 matches of an IPL season for 1st time as LSG chase down 211-run target
143.article_body: LSG defeated CSK by six wickets to register their first victory in IPL 2022. LSG recorded the highest successful run chase in IPL 2022 so far by chasing down 211-run target in 19.3 overs. CSK have now lost first two matches of an IPL season for the first time in history. Quinton de Kock top-scored for LSG with 61(45).

144.title: Pakistan record their highest successful chase in ODI cricket history
144.article_body: Pakistan chased down 349-run target in the second ODI against Australia to register their highest successful chase in ODI history and level the three-match series 1-1. Pakistan captain Babar Azam and opener Imam-ul-Haq slammed hundreds in the match. Pakistan's previous highest successful ODI run chase had come on March 4, 2014, when they chased down a 327-run target against Bangladesh.

145.title: Masked burglar breaks into David Beckham's London mansion while the family was inside
145.article_body: A masked burglar broke into David Beckham's west London mansion while David, Victoria Beckham and their 10-year-old daughter Harper were inside. The burglar ran off with thousands of pounds of designer goods, The Sun reported. Beckham's 17-year-old son Cruz discovered that their house had been burgled when he arrived back home from a night out with friends, the report added.

146.title: Independent foreign policy doesn't mean being anti-India: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
146.article_body: During his address to the nation, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan said an independent foreign policy doesn't mean being anti-India. He stated, "I decided that my foreign policy will be independent. An independent foreign policy is one which is meant for Pakistanis. It doesn't mean we are anyone's enemies. It doesn't mean we will be anti-Americans, anti-India or anti-European."

147.title: Will play till last ball, won't accept defeat: Pak PM ahead of no-confidence motion
147.article_body: Ahead of the no-confidence motion, Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Thursday hinted he won't resign. "People saying Imran...will resign. If you know me from my cricket days, I'm not the one to accept defeat. I'll fight till the last ball," the former Pakistan cricket team captain said. He said he'll come back stronger regardless of the outcome of Sunday's vote.

148.title: Future Retail CEO Sadashiv Nayak resigns after 7 months of his appointment
148.article_body: Future Retail's CEO Sadashiv Nayak has resigned from his role, more than seven months after taking up the role. Nayak has been with Future Group for around 18 years and had been appointed CEO in August 2021. This comes amid Future Retail's legal battle with US e-commerce giant Amazon over a $3.4-billion sale of its retail assets to Reliance Industries.

149.title: The whole movie is beautifully made: Srinidhi Shetty on KGF 1
149.article_body: In an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla, actress Srinidhi Shetty said she felt pressure after the release of KGF: Part 1. "The whole movie is beautifully made," she said. She further said doing the movie was a "conscious decision and equally a risk," adding, "People who started with me in 2016, have already done 10 movies...so it does affect a...bit."

150.title: Don't want gifts, please feed stray animals instead: Rupali Ganguly
150.article_body: Television actress Rupali Ganguly ahead of her birthday on April 5 made a request to her followers and fans on Instagram. She went live on the social media platform and said, "Instead of sending birthday gifts to me...please feed stray animals that would come as...direct blessing to me." She added, "Please help me in fulfilling my dream of creating...animal shelter."

151.title: Comedian Bharti Singh rejects rumours of being blessed with a girl
151.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh recently quashed rumours claiming that she has given birth to a baby girl. She said, "It's not true. I am on...sets of Khatra Khatra. There was a break for 15-20 minutes. So, I decided to come live and clarify that I'm still working." She asked her fans to wait for her to announce the big news.

152.title: It was so difficult: Vidya on having to 'throw a baby' in 'Abhay 3'
152.article_body: Actress Vidya Malavade while recalling her experience on the sets of her upcoming web show 'Abhay 3' said she had to throw a baby for her introduction scene. "I was like 'My goodness! What are you making me do?' It was so difficult," she said. She called the baby cute while adding that she plays the role of a sorceress.

153.title: David, Victoria Beckham's London mansion robbed while they slept
153.article_body: David Beckham and Victoria Beckham's London mansion has reportedly been robbed. As per a report, the couple was said to be inside the house with their 10-year-old daughter Harper when the incident took place. They were reportedly unaware of the thief, who is said to have escaped with thousands of pounds of designer and electric goods from the house.

154.title: Eighth Russian Colonel Kurilo killed in Kharkiv: Ukraine
154.article_body: The Ukrainian military said an eighth Russian colonel has been killed since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. They said Colonel Denis Kurilo was "liquidated" by Ukrainian forces during fighting near Kharkiv. Western officials say around 20 Russian generals have been deployed to Ukraine. Kurilo was in charge of the 200th separate motorised rifle brigade.

155.title: Over 40 Indians still in Ukraine, only few want to return: Minister
155.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs of India Meenakashi Lekhi on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that around 40-50 Indians are still stuck in Ukraine. In a written response to a question on the number of people evacuated, she said that 22,500 Indians have returned and while 40-50 are still stuck, only a few are willing to return.

156.title: Stop all trade with Russia: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy to Dutch Parliament
156.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday addressed the Dutch Parliament, asking them to stop all trade with Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. "Stronger sanctions are needed so that Russia doesn't have a chance to pursue this war further in Europe," he said. The Netherlands has supplied Ukraine with military equipment including Patriot air defence systems and anti-tank rockets.

157.title: We will fight for every metre of our land: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
157.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said Ukrainian troops will "fight for every metre of our land, for every person" amid Russia's invasion which began on February 24. "There is an accumulation of Russian troops for new strikes in Donbas and we are preparing for this," he said. Over 10,000 Russian soldiers have reportedly been killed so far in Ukraine.

158.title: Remove parts that hurt Brahmin sentiments: K’taka textbook panel
158.article_body: The school textbook review committee set up by the Karnataka government has said that content "hurting Brahmin sentiment" should be removed. The introductory part of chapter six in the class 8 social sciences textbook blames the Vedic way of life for the rise of religions like Jainism and Buddhism in India, said the head of the review committee, Rohith Chakrathirtha.

159.title: I have struggled mentally and emotionally for a long time: F1’s Hamilton
159.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said he has struggled mentally and emotionally for a long time, saying it is "hard some days to stay positive." Hamilton finished third and tenth for Mercedes in the opening two races of the season in Bahrain and Saudi Arabia respectively. "We have so much to do and to achieve," he said.

160.title: Premier League clubs vote to allow 5 substitutions from next season
160.article_body: Premier League clubs on Thursday voted to allow five substitutions from next season. Substitutions were increased from three temporarily in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. However, the Premier League decided against changing the rule permanently for the 2020/21 campaign. The Premier League also confirmed the 2022 summer transfer window will open on June 10 and close on September 1.

161.title: Man in New Zealand jailed for threatening to kill PM Jacinda Ardern
161.article_body: A man in New Zealand on Thursday was sentenced to one year in prison for threatening to kill Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern. Prosecutors said Michael Cruickshank, 56, sent 88 emails between 2019 and 2020 to government officials calling them slave-traders, criminals and state-sponsored terrorists. In one email that he sent in January 2020, Cruickshank threatened to blow Ardern's head off.

162.title: 1 killed, 2 injured after US Navy plane crashes off Eastern coast
162.article_body: One person was killed while two others were injured on Wednesday after a US Navy plane crashed in waters near the eastern shore boundary of Virginia and Maryland. The Navy said the deceased crew member was found dead in the aircraft while the other two crew members were rescued by Maryland state police. Officials said they had broken legs.

163.title: Shaheen is a great bowler, I learn a lot from him: Pak bowling coach Tait
163.article_body: Calling Shaheen Shah Afridi "mature and skillful" for his age, Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait said the 21-year-old pacer is a "great bowler". He added, "Shaheen asks a lot of questions. So far, I've enjoyed my time with him and I actually learned a lot from him." Shaheen registered bowling figures of 24.3-3-79-4 in Australia's first innings of third Test.

164.title: Will suggest President to impose Article 355 in WB: Cong leader
164.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Tuesday said that he will meet the President of India over Birbhum violence and will suggest that he considers imposing Article 355 in West Bengal. Chowdhury further said that the special investigation team (SIT) that is probing the matter is of "no use". "Law and order situation is getting worse," he added.

165.title: Not a big fan of pink-ball cricket: Mohammed Azharuddin
165.article_body: Ex-India skipper Mohammed Azharuddin said he's not a big fan of pink-ball cricket (Day-Night Tests). "With Tests, it has to be with...red ball. It's a long-standing tradition and should be upheld in my opinion," he explained. "I know it's getting results, but bowlers and batters have had complaints too in...past," he added. India have three wins from four pink-ball Tests.

166.title: Greek Foreign Minister to personally lead aid mission to Mariupol
166.article_body: Greek Foreign Minister Nikos Dendias said he intends to personally lead a humanitarian aid mission to Ukraine's Mariupol where thousands of ethnic Greeks live. He added that Greece's priority was to protect unarmed civilians and ethnic Greeks in Mariupol. The Greek government said at least 10 ethnic Greeks have been killed, while over 150 Greek citizens have been evacuated.

167.title: Filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola receives Hollywood Walk of Fame star
167.article_body: Filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola has been honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star on Monday. 'The Godfather' trilogy, 'Apocalypse Now', 'The Outsiders' and 'Bram Stoker's Dracula' are among Francis' notable works. Francis is the 2,715th celebrity to receive the star. The ceremony was attended by actresses Elle Fanning and Talia Shire.

168.title: Staff strikes cause cancellations, delays at 8 German airports
168.article_body: Security staff at eight German airports including Frankfurt on Tuesday went on strike over pay issues, causing widespread cancellations and delays. The strikes, called by the German workers' union ver.di, followed walkouts at several German airports last week. Over 100 of the 790 scheduled flights at Frankfurt were cancelled by Tuesday morning. All 88 flights scheduled at Hamburg were cancelled.

169.title: Whole country will be very closely watching Hardik in IPL 2022: Shastri
169.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said the whole country would be watching Hardik Pandya "very closely" in IPL 2022. Hardik will be leading Gujarat Titans as the new franchise debuts in the T20 league. Due to a lower back injury, the India all-rounder is yet to play any competitive match post 2020 T20 World Cup in the UAE.

170.title: Egypt, UAE & Israel leaders meet for 1st ever three-way summit
170.article_body: Leaders of Egypt, Israel and UAE met in Sharm El-Sheikh in a first-ever three-way summit since UAE normalised relations with Israel in 2020. Discussions on energy market stability and food security amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine were held at the meeting. Israeli PM Naftali Bennett's office said the countries focussed on strengthening ties on all levels.

171.title: Sorry to say, Muslim nations didn't do anything to check Islamophobia: Imran Khan
171.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Tuesday said Islamophobia grew after the 9/11 terror attacks, adding, "The reason was- I'm sorry to say- we the Muslim countries didn't do anything to check [it]." He said, "I've spent a lot of my life in England, touring all over the world as a...sportsman. I understand western civilisation probably much better than most people."

172.title: He is greatest batter I've seen in my era: Khawaja on Steve Smith
172.article_body: Following Steve Smith's third consecutive half-century in ongoing three-match Test series against Pakistan, Usman Khawaja said the 32-year-old Australian is greatest batter for him he's seen in his era, averaging 60 throughout his whole Test career. "He seems to be getting 70, 80 [in] every game...doing it very easily," he added. Smith scored 169-ball 59 in third Test in Lahore.

173.title: Must continue monitoring Musk's tweets: US SEC
173.article_body: US SEC on Tuesday urged a federal US judge to not let Tesla CEO Elon Musk escape a 2018 agreement requiring supervision of Musk's Twitter use.
