348.article_body: After being criticised over his 'Truth must be spoken tenderly' tweet on 'The Kashmir Files', actor Adil Hussain tweeted, "My tweet was a general comment about my idea of Art. And I stand by it." He added, "I was flummoxed by most of the reactions to tweet in question...This tweet of mine is probably the most ill-timed tweet ever."

349.title: Champions are made like this: Harbhajan on 19-yr-old seen running at night in viral clip
349.article_body: Reacting to the viral video of 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra who was seen running in the night in Noida, former Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "He will be a winner." "Champions are made like this...whether on sports field or anything they do in life," he wrote. Former England cricketer Kevin Pietersen said, "This will make your...morning. What a guy!"

350.title: Ambani's Jio World Centre in Mumbai gets armed CISF cover: Report
350.article_body: The Union government has sanctioned armed security cover of over 200 CISF personnel to guard the Jio World Centre opened by Reliance Industries in Mumbai, PTI reported. The business and entertainment centre, spread across 18.5 acres in Bandra Kurla Complex, will receive counter-terrorist cover. Mukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani are protectees of the CRPF VIP security wing.

351.title: Burn more bodies per day: S Korea to crematoriums amid rising COVID deaths
351.article_body: Amid rising number of COVID-19 deaths, health officials in South Korea have ordered crematoriums to burn more bodies per day and funeral homes to add more refrigerators to store dead bodies. South Korea is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to the Omicron variant. So far, the country has reported more than 99.3 lakh virus cases and over 13,140 coronavirus-related deaths.

352.title: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy to virtually address Japanese Parliament
352.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will virtually address the Japanese Parliament on Wednesday amid Russia's ongoing military offensive in Ukraine. Zelenskyy, who has also made virtual addresses in US Congress and Parliaments of Israel and Canada, is expected to speak for about 10 minutes. Notably, Japan has adopted sanctions against Russia and also sent non-lethal military aid to Ukraine.

353.title: US lawmakers raise concerns around Musk's business in China: WSJ
353.article_body: Some US lawmakers have raised concerns over Elon Musk-owned SpaceX's ties in China, questioning if Beijing could exploit the ties to gain access to classified information through its foreign suppliers, the WSJ reported. Utah's Representative Chris Stewart reportedly said, "I am a fan of Elon Musk...but anyone would be concerned if there are financial entanglements with China."

354.title: Woman arrested with 2 kg cannabis in Noida's Sector 81: Police
354.article_body: A married woman was arrested with two kgs of cannabis in Noida, police officials said on Monday. The "accused...was held near the Sector 81 metro station road close to Shiv Shakti Enclave", they added. "An FIR has been lodged against her...under the provisions of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," they further said.

355.title: CBI to probe Gurugram's Chintels society incident: Haryana CM Khattar
355.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced in the state assembly that the Chintels society incident would be probed by the CBI. Two women were killed after a portion of a tower collapsed at Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso society in Sector-109. Following the incident, an FIR was registered against the builder, contractor and five other parties.

356.title: Ghaziabad civic body starts construction of 5 sports facilities
356.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has started constructing sporting facilities in five different areas in its jurisdiction. "The corporation maintains several parks in the city, but people don't prefer to play sports in parks. This is why the corporation decided to develop the...facilities," an official said. Some commercial sports centres will also be developed in Ghaziabad, the official added.

357.title: What is wrong with saffronisation of education system: VP Naidu
357.article_body: Responding to allegations that the BJP government is saffronising India's education system, Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu, said, "what is wrong with saffron?". He further urged Indians at large to give up their "colonial mindset" and learn to take pride in their Indian identity. He added that "Indianisation" of the country's education system is the aim of new education policy.

358.title: Delhi airport to get 2 rainwater storage tanks of total 9 million litre capacity
358.article_body: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport is setting up two rainwater storage tanks, Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL), the airport's operator, said on Tuesday. "The two reservoirs, one near Terminal 1 and the other near Terminal 2, will become operational in the coming monsoon. These would help the airport store about nine million litres of rainwater," DIAL added.

359.title: Will support Pakistan in defending territorial integrity: China
359.article_body: China has said that it will support Pakistan in "defending its sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity" no matter what changes happen internationally or within the two countries. "China will stick to its friendly policy towards Pakistan, firmly support the Pakistani people in taking a development path that fits their own national conditions," said Foreign Minister Wang Yi.

360.title: We've got praise across the world: Foreign Secy on Pak PM's comments
360.article_body: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla on Monday said India has received praise from across the world for several of its foreign policy initiatives. "To say that one person (praised our foreign policy) would be wrong," he said when asked about Pakistan PM Imran Khan's comment. Khan had praised India for following an independent foreign policy amid the Ukraine-Russia war.

361.title: Was told I wasn't fat enough; they wanted someone fatter: 'Bhabi...' actor Soma
361.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' fame Soma Rathod spoke about her struggling days in the industry and revealed that she was body-shamed. She said, "I was told I wasn't fat enough and they were looking for someone fatter." "So, I was neither slim nor fat...We do not even get clothes for our size, why don't they make clothes our size?"

362.title: Jobs & I never had to stretch truth during Apple's early days: Wozniak
362.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak while discussing Apple's early days said Steve Jobs and him never had to "stretch the truth" during those days. "Everything was gold and our Apple II computer was so far ahead of the competition," he said. "We were so far ahead...they (competitors) were trying to do something I had already done five years before," Wozniak added.

363.title: History textbooks in schools aren't fully based on facts: Govt official
363.article_body: History textbooks of the NCERT are criticised as they "are not based entirely on facts", Secretary of the Department of School Education and Literacy (under Education Ministry) has said. History textbooks also offer opinions and arguments, Anita Karwal (also CBSE ex-Chairperson) said, adding, "A child should be able to distinguish between all this and come to a conclusion."

364.title: We didn't get partnerships, it cost us the game vs India: B'desh captain Sultana
364.article_body: Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana has said that they bowled "wonderfully" against India in their Women's ODI World Cup match. "We put pressure on India at times...but we didn't get enough partnerships...That's what cost us the game," she stated. Chasing India's 229-run total, Bangladesh lost the match by 110 runs. They will face Australia and England in their remaining two matches.

365.title: Water supply to parts of Pune will be affected on March 24 & 25
365.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation announced on Tuesday that water supply in parts of the city will be cut off on March 24 due to urgent maintenance work. Moreover, it added that on March 25, water will be supplied at low pressure. The areas that will be affected include Dattawadi premises, Deccan premises, Ekalavya College premises, MES and HE Factory, among others.

366.title: Pune Police increase patrolling in hilly areas after robbery incident
366.article_body: Pune Police said they have intensified patrolling in hilly areas after a recent robbery was reported at the city's Pashan Hill. Police referred to an incident that occurred on Friday, wherein three people threatened a duo and compelled them to digitally transfer ₹76,000. "We [advise] people to exercise caution and avoid going [to] these areas when it's dark," police added.

367.title: Campus Activewear gets SEBI's nod for IPO launch
367.article_body: Footwear brand Campus Activewear has received market regulator SEBI's approval for an IPO launch. Promoters Hari Krishan Agarwal and Nikhil Aggarwal will cumulatively sell 1.4 crore shares of the 5.1 crore shares that will be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to the shareholders and the company will not receive any of the funds.

368.title: Lalu suffering from heart & kidney issues, to be shifted to AIIMS Delhi: Doctor
368.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is hospitalised in Jharkhand's Ranchi, would be shifted to AIIMS Delhi as he is facing heart and kidney-related issues, a doctor said. Lalu has been sentenced to five years in prison by a special CBI court in connection with the fifth fodder scam case. He has previously been convicted in four fodder scam cases.

369.title: He's got amazing attitude, vantage point as wicketkeeper: Ashwin on Samson
369.article_body: Praising 27-year-old wicketkeeper-batter and RR skipper Sanju Samson, Ravichandran Ashwin said he has a great attitude for the game and will definitely get better in future. "He's always open for discussion, open to opinions around the game," he added. "Sanju has got the vantage point as a wicketkeeper to judge the game with all the angles," Ashwin further said.

370.title: Policeman injured in shootout with terrorists in J&K; critical
370.article_body: A policeman was injured in a shootout between terrorists and security forces near the Zoonimar area of Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, police said, adding that he is critical. The policeman has been shifted to a nearby hospital. The police added that a terrorist was also injured but he probably ran away from the spot.

371.title: Punjab govt makes 35,000 temporary employees of Group C and D permanent
371.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government on Tuesday said that it has decided to make 35,000 temporary employees of Group C and D permanent. "Today, Aam Aadmi Party Punjab government has taken another historic decision...started the process to regularise 35,000 contractual government employees," Mann tweeted. "I've directed Chief Secretary to end such contractual and outsourcing recruitments," he said.

372.title: Govt made 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free to spread hatred: Former J&K CM
372.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday said the central government wants to "further spread hatred in people's hearts" by making the movie 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free. "They (government) are saying that every policeman and soldier...should see this movie, so that they hate us to the extreme," he added. "It is a propaganda movie," Abdullah further said.

373.title: Why can't we make films like 'Avengers', 'White House Down': John
373.article_body: Actor John Abraham speaking to the media stated, "Be it 'Avengers' or 'White House Down', why can't we make such films?" The actor further said that the Indian film industry can make films which can make the world see and say 'Wow, India can make such films too'. "If Hollywood can do it, why can't Bollywood?" John added.

374.title: Yamuna will be cleaned by Dec 2023, not 2025: Satyendar Jain
374.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday advanced the deadline for cleaning Yamuna from 2025 to December 2023. Wastewater will be tapped in next six months and all areas will be linked to the sewer network in next 15 months, Jain said. "We'll invite you to take a dip in any stretch of the river in Delhi," he added.

375.title: Pic of govt official's signature goes viral; people say 'how will banks verify?
375.article_body: The signature of an official at the Gauhati Medical College and Hospital has gone viral on social media. Several Twitter users reacted to the signature, with one of them saying, "How will banks verify? Will they count the number of quills the porcupine has?" "Ask him to sign again...will not be able to match same number of loops," said another.

376.title: Was filled with energy by Ponting's speech, felt goosebumps: Sakariya
376.article_body: Fast bowler Chetan Sakariya, who will represent DC in IPL 2022, said, "I had heard a lot about [DC head coach] Ricky Ponting...that you will feel goosebumps [while]...in the huddle and that is exactly what happened." "The moment he ended his speech, I was filled with so much energy that I thought of...knocking the stumps over by bowling," added Sakariya.

377.title: ED searches premises linked to Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla
377.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday searched premises linked to Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla. ED had arrested Malik in a money-laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim and his aides on February 23. On Monday, a special court extended Malik's judicial custody till April 4 and allowed him to be provided with a mattress, bed and chair.

378.title: 165 kg ganja worth over ₹6 lakh seized in Odisha, 2 arrested
378.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of Odisha Police seized 165 kg of ganja worth over ₹6 lakh and arrested two people. The accused were apprehended during a raid  in Angul district on Monday. According to police, one of the accused is an employee of a nationalised bank. Police also seized one single barrel gun from their possession.

379.title: Japan summons Russian envoy after Moscow halts peace treaty talks
379.article_body: Japan's Vice Foreign Minister Takeo Mori summoned Russia's ambassador to Japan on Tuesday, Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Moscow decided to halt peace treaty talks with Tokyo in response to sanctions imposed by Japan over the Ukraine invasion. Russia and Japan have still not formally ended World War II hostilities due to a dispute over islands north of Hokkaido.

380.title: After what happened in SA, Team India didn't want to take chances: Gavaskar
380.article_body: Discussing pitches for Team India's 2-0 whitewash in the Test series against Sri Lanka, Sunil Gavaskar said, "After what happened in South Africa, it is understandable that they...prepared pitches that suited their strength." South Africa beat India by a 2-1 margin in the three-match Test series, with India yet to record a maiden Test series win on South African soil.

381.title: PM Modi-led govt not at all reluctant to loot poor: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
381.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi-led government is not at all reluctant to "loot" the poor. "We said that there'll be an exorbitant rise in fuel prices post the Assembly elections, we have been proven right," Chowdhury added. "We'll stand against this for common people both outside and inside the Lok Sabha," Chowdhury stated.

382.title: Save water, adopt sustainable practices: RS Chairman Naidu urges MPs
382.article_body: On the occasion of 'World Water Day', Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu requested parliamentarians to conserve water. "We must adopt sustainable water management practices both in personal and public life and sensitise one and all in inculcating water conservation techniques," Naidu said. He further stressed on the importance of groundwater for the sustenance of life.

383.title: If somebody says you've to leave job for house, he isn't right partner: Shweta
383.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari said that if someone asks one to leave their job for house [work], then he isn't the right partner. "You can't leave your security. Nobody tells you to leave your dreams and independence for your family," she said in a video, adding, "The right partner stands with you and supports you to be independent."

384.title: Priyanka Chopra to co-host pre-Oscars event on South Asian Excellence
384.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra will be co-hosting a pre-Oscars event celebrating South Asian Excellence on Wednesday in Beverly Hills. Mindy Kaling, Kumail Nanjiani, Anjula Acharia, Bela Bajaria and Maneesh K among others will also be co-hosts. Special guests for the event include writers and producers of Indian documentary 'Writing With Fire' Rintu Thomas, Sushmit Ghosh and Anurima Bhargava.

385.title: Doctor couple denied bail over fake COVID vaccination camp in Mumbai
385.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai has denied bail to a doctor couple, Neeta Pataria and Shivraj Pataria, for allegedly being involved in a fake COVID-19 vaccination camp in June last year. Nearly 206 people were given bogus vaccines and the couple was given ₹3 lakh as fees, claimed the police. The court said the couple played with people's lives.

386.title: Mayor of Ukrainian city advises civilians to flee as battle nears
386.article_body: With the Russian forces coming close, the mayor of Ukraine's Boryspil has advised the civilians to flee. "There is no need to be in the city now as there is already fighting going on in the area around it. I call on the civilian population to be smart and leave as soon as an opportunity arises," said Mayor Volodymyr Borysenko.

387.title: Ukraine-returned medical students in K'taka to continue studies in 60 colleges
387.article_body: The Karnataka government will help 700 medical students, who returned to the state from war-hit Ukraine, continue their education in 60 medical colleges in the state, state Health and Medical Education Minister K Sudhakar said. Sudhakar, however, added that the students will not be officially absorbed into the colleges. No additional fee will be charged from the students, he said.

388.title: Which are the highest revenue-generating football clubs as per Deloitte Money League?
388.article_body: Manchester City have topped the Deloitte Football Money League for the first time as the world's highest revenue-generating club in 2020-21 season. Manchester City topped the list with €644.9-million revenue. They were followed by Real Madrid (€640.7 million) and Bayern Munich (€611.4 million). Barcelona dropped three places to be ranked fourth on the list with €582.1-million revenue.

389.title: Russian Grandmaster Sergey Karjakin banned for 6 months over pro-Russia comments
389.article_body: Russian Grandmaster Sergey Karjakin has been banned from competition for six months by the International Chess Federation (FIDE) over his pro-Russia comments amid war with Ukraine. After being banned, Karjakin, who represented Ukraine before adopting Russian citizenship in 2009, said, "First...I am a patriot of my country and only second of all I am an athlete. I don't regret anything."

390.title: Why is temperature above normal in March this year?
390.article_body: With several states/UTs recording above normal temperature in March this year, IMD's Director General Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said one of the reason could be that there were no active western disturbances, which bring colder winds. The lack of pre-monsoon showers has contributed to the overall heating. Hot winds from deserts of northwest India contribute to soaring temperatures in central regions.

391.title: Plane crash with 132 on board is China's 1st fatal accident in 12 years
391.article_body: With 132 people on board, the plane crash that took place on Monday is the first fatal accident in China in 12 years. China's last plane crash was in 2010 when an Embraer E-190 regional jet flown by Henan Airlines crashed due to low visibility, killing 44 of 96 people on board. No survivors have been found from Monday's crash.

392.title: Suzuki, SkyDrive partner to develop, market electric aircraft
392.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor has signed a deal with SkyDrive to partner up for research, development and marketing of electric, vertical takeoff and landing aircraft. The firms said they will also work to open up new markets with an initial focus on India. SkyDrive is currently focussing on development of a compact, two-seating electric-powered flying car with plans for full-scale production.

393.title: RSS is similar to Jinnah, both divide people: Assam AIUDF MLA
393.article_body: An All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA from Assam, Rafiqul Islam, has equated RSS to Pakistan's founder Muhammad Ali Jinnah. "Jinnah divided the country into two parts - India and Pakistan...BJP and RSS are also doing the same thing, and they are dividing Hindu and Muslim, Dalits and non-Dalits," the MLA from Jania constituency said.

394.title: Heat in Gurugram likely to rise, temp to cross 41°C by end of this week
394.article_body: IMD has predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 41°C by the end of this week. It said the maximum temperature in the city is likely to increase by five degrees and hover around 41°C by Saturday. Gurugram recorded a maximum temperature of 37.8°C on Sunday, the highest temperature the city has seen so far this year.

395.title: Wallets, ID cards of people presumed dead in China plane crash found
395.article_body: Wallets, bank cards and official identity cards, that belonged to the 132 people presumed dead in the China Eastern Airlines crash, were found on a mountainside on Tuesday. The items were lined up by rescue workers scouring the mountainside. The Boeing 737 aircraft, travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou on Monday, is believed to have 'nosedived' before crashing in the mountains.

396.title: Adil criticised over his tweet on 'The Kashmir…', actor says it was 'ill-timed'
396.article_body: Adil Hussain was criticised for his tweet on 'The Kashmir Files', where he shared his views on the film and tweeted, "Truth must be spoken but tenderly or else truth loses its beauty". Reacting to it, a user wrote, "If you're Muslim then no matter what you'll support Terrorism." Later, Adil apologised and called it "the most ill-timed tweet ever".

397.title: Shiv Sena will always remain a Hindutva party: Sanjay Raut
397.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that his party was a "Hindutva party" and will always remain the same. "The question of political ideology should be asked to BJP when they formed government with Mehbooba Mufti in Kashmir, where did their political ideology go?" he added. Earlier, Raut had said that BJP is doing politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir.

398.title: Bill to merge 3 municipal corporations of Delhi cleared by Cabinet
398.article_body: The Union Cabinet on Tuesday cleared the Delhi Municipal Corporation Amendment Act 2022, for the unification of all three municipal corporations of Delhi. Reportedly, the bill will be tabled in the Parliament next week. Earlier, State Election Commission delayed the MCD polls after receiving communication regarding the unification. Subsequently, AAP criticised the Centre for pressurising SEC.

399.title: Delhi govt to build Shaheed Bhagat Singh Armed Forces Preparatory School
399.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday announced that the Delhi government will build Shaheed Bhagat Singh Armed Forces Preparatory School. The school, where students will be trained for the armed forces, will be built on 14 acres of land in Jharoda Kalan, he added. "The fees for the school will be free...will have separate hostels for boys and girls," Kejriwal stated.

400.title: Opposition walks out of Lok Sabha over fuel, cooking gas price hike
400.article_body: Members of the opposition parties staged a protest in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday against the rise in prices of petrol, diesel and domestic cooking gas. They then staged a walkout demanding a rollback. Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked by 80 paise a litre and domestic cooking gas prices have been increased by ₹50 per cylinder.
